column4: hi, i have a portable usb harddrive. How to put it work in ubuntu?
do u think i need special linux driver for this?
it works fine in other pc with other os
it's 5.10, not 5.1, and gksudo update-manager should ask you if you want to upgrade, provided youre up to date
I have downloaded the cd. how do i upgrade? just put a dics and install?
well, you don't need the disk actually, it can do everything via apt/downloads
how do i check the version of my current ubuntu?
gksudo update-manager should ask you about upgrading.
It's starting. Will it erase my data?
Do you think it will be faster if i upgrade by cd instead of downloading from internet?
depends on your download speed, of course.  If you upgrade via apt, youll be completely up to date afterwards, via the CD, you'll still need to update some stuff.
7.10 is still in alpha stages, 7.04 is the latest stable
thanks I am gonna download that
